parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to 'grave', especially to write; figuratively, to describe.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The knee. Of uncertain affinity; the 'knee'.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To bend, bow. Apparently a primary verb; to bend.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The tongue; by implication, a language.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From ek and homologeo; to acknowledge or agree fully.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
